channel.title: Georectifying-maps on Introduction to mapping and spatial methods for the humanities
channel.description: Recent content in Georectifying-maps on Introduction to mapping and spatial methods for the humanities

item.title: Georectifying maps
item.description: Overview Existing maps, floorplans and imagery are a useful source of data. They can provide information about changes over time, landcover, settlement patterns, and more. In this exercise, we’ll use the web-based tool Map Warper to add geographic coordinates to existing maps in order to view them alongside contemporary data. Data files 1901 Fire Insurance Plan of Ottawa 1842 Map of Bytown 1856 Map of Ottawa 1911 Map of Ottawa 1933 Airphoto A4571_64 1933 Airphoto A4571_65 1933 Airphoto A4571_66 Useful links Map Warper Creating a Map Warper account From the Map Warper homepage, click on Create Account to sign up for a free account, then log in.
